answers.answer: We want to give students the unique opportunity to improve and learn from possible mistakes on their first passed attempt. The willingness to deal with the module again should be rewarded.
The maximum duration of studies should continue to be limited in order to keep degrees comparable within the meaning of the Bologna Agreement.

A greater freedom of choice in the main study period (from the 4th semester) enables students to specialise more and to deepen their own interests. Thus, interdisciplinary courses of study can also be improved. Freedom of choice should remain restricted in the basic study period, as this is where the foundations for further education are laid.

With growing student numbers and dwindling library space, it is absolutely essential to expand the number of places available for learning. Additional learning rooms for groups can be created at short notice.
We remain committed to ensuring that studying at the TUM is free of tuition fees and thus possible for everyone.

The Student Council should continue to work only on student issues and not on general policy. The main task of the Student Council is and will remain the commitment to the interests of the students and the improvement of study conditions.
The RCDS-TUM is of the opinion that coordination with the university management is not generally necessary, but often makes sense in order to achieve common goals.
It is important that students are informed about university policy issues. Only in this way can they be given the opportunity to participate constructively in the opinion-forming process.

In our view, a student parliament is a better model than the student council, since students are represented more directly and transparently. Because currently, the representatives in the student council are only indirectly elected via the respective student representatives.

We are particularly critical of the general political mandate of the constituted student body. Student representatives should only advocate for student concerns. In addition, a nationwide representation of interests through the Landes ASten Konferenz is already in place.

Student festivals and parties are part of student life at the TUM and should be maintained. They are an important component for many students. However, this should not be at the expense of university policy.
We believe that voluntary work should also remain unpaid. We do not see any improvement for the students if the student representatives receive an expense allowance.
We are generally against a general political commitment of the student council. This includes movements such as Fridays For Future etc.

Student assistants are also students for the applies. Are not represented in contrast to other employees. In order to be able to include their interests in opinion-forming processes, it is necessary to consider the interests of the student representatives. In the long term, this will lead to a sustainable increase in the quality of teaching.
Currently there is always at least one vegetarian or vegan dish. The Studentenwerk should decide on the basis of demand which dishes are offered to avoid food waste.
We support this proposal as a contribution to energy system transformation. Nevertheless, it should be considered on which buildings an installation is reasonable and structurally possible.

Currently, a large part of TUM's funds already comes from business partners. These funds enable excellent research and also teaching, which could not be financed by state funds. It also promotes the exchange between research and industry.

For reasons of data protection, we reject the use of Proctorio as a exam tool. A combination of TUMExam and monitoring with BigBlueButton already offers a good alternative. In addition, it would also save costs. In general we prefer an examination in presence.
The legal department of the TUM has already arranged that an exam in presence has to take place parallel to online exams.
In our opinion, this step was necessary to ensure a punctual start of the semester. However, self-hosted open-source alternatives should be set up for the future. One example is BigBlueButton.
Due to data protection concerns, self-hosted open-source alternatives should be established for the future. One example is BigBlueButton.
In general, the RCDS-TUM takes a positive view of this, e.g. to avoid relocation. However, we reject a pure online lecture.
The RCDS-TUM sees digital exams as an emergency solution rather than a permanent solution.

For reasons of infection, this year's university elections were to be conducted by postal vote. The voting documents should be sent out automatically in order to reach as many students as possible. In general, the RCDS-TUM supports online elections.
We see the TUM here in the duty to provide access to information concerning financial and health aid programs, especially multilingual.

questions.question: It should be possible to voluntarily retake an exam, even after a successful attempt.
The maximum study duration should remain limited by credit hurdles.
The students should have greater freedom of choice in their Bachelor's degree.
All seminar rooms should be usable as study rooms during weekends and examination periods.
Tuition fees should be reintroduced at TUM.
The Student Council should also express its opinion on issues that do not exclusively concern studies and student life.
The Student Council should coordinate the content of public statements with the university management.
The Student Council should provide more public information about its university policy work.
The Council of Student Representatives should be replaced by a directly elected student parliament.
The Student Council should advocate for a constituted student body.
The Student Council should use a large part of its resources for the organisation of festivals like the TU/GARNIX.
The student representatives in the senate and AStA should receive an expense allowance for their voluntary work.
The Mensa must offer at least one vegetarian and one vegan dish each day.
Solar panels are to be installed on all university buildings.
The Student Council should support Fridays For Future.
The Student Council should support the interests of student assistants and tutors.
Research at the TUM may be financed by business partners.
Proctorio is an acceptable tool for holding online exams.

A student is disadvantaged, if he/she does not wish to partake in a potentially privacy-violating examination format, as he/she is only able to retake the examination in a further semester alternatively.
The fast introduction of Zoom at the TUM was justified despite data protection concerns.
TUM should continue to use Zoom and should NOT switch to self-hosted services (e.g. BigBlueButton or Jitsi).
Even after Corona, it should be possible to hold lectures/practical courses online exclusively.
There should also be the possibility for digital exams even after Corona.
Voting in university elections should be exclusively done via postal votes.
TUM should actively support students, who have financial or health problems due to Corona.
